poem.title: Loitering within Tent
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: A damp and uncomfortable camping holiday Army surplus tents. A couple of Army surplus tenants tagged along And a jeep thrown in. You invited us round for drinks Just the sweat and mildewed four of us. I thought no Yet that carpeted sunlight, the welcome air And you in muslin - linen, surely? I caught the theme: rough canvas, hemp Then linen; underneath that - silk, Then what? You wore a hairband. When's The last time you wore that? Till noon Mendelssohn's big hit, clang clang like tinnitus. You're not getting married, are you? Not again?
